comment.author: 14651149@N00
comment._content: This must be Eleanor Randolph Wilson McAdoo. Daughter of Woodrow Wilson, and second wife of William Gibbs McAdoo, who was Secretary of the Treasury at the time this photo was taken. Eleanor was 26 years younger than McAdoo. Here are the two together: LC-DIG-hec-18045

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of January 31, 1915 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10E16F93A5A12738... said that Miss Nona McAdoo (daughter of the Secretary of the Treasury) and Miss Katherine Britton were off to Europe on the Lusitania on 1/30/1915, as nurses -- to a hospital in San Remo, France. So this was presumably Eleanor's step-daughter.

comment.author: 14651149@N00
comment._content: Ah, very good swanq. There is a resemblance though you have to admit.
